Machine Learning¶

Application of support vector machines in detecting hand grasp gestures using a commercially off the shelf wireless myoelectric armband¶

Authors:Amirabdollahian, Farshid Walters, Michael L.
DOI:10.1109/ICORR.2017.8009231

Notes¶

Details a way of using support vector machines to develop a classification of myoelectric waveforms into hand gestures.

Makes use of the Thalmic Labs Myo armband.

Very simple implementation using python svm library

Takeaways¶

Should be an easily replicable test for learning SVM and delving into myoelectric measurementa and controls

Support VectorMachine-Based Classification Scheme forMyoelectric Control Applied to Upper Limb¶

Authors:Oskoei, M.a. Hu, Huosheng
DOI:10.1109/TBME.2008.919734

Notes¶

A more detailed explanation of the svm techniques used by “Application of support vector machines in detecting hand grasp gestures using a commercially off the shelf wireless myoelectric armband”

Takeaways¶

Reference for parameters and feature selection for svm classification of myoelectric signals
